messages.message: hey man I have a question for you?

Brian
what's up?
do you remember the DC++ server that was set up?

Brian
yes
Any idea how to start one? What software to make the hub?

Brian
http://www.google.com/search?q=DC%2B%2B+server&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&client=firefox-a
thats what i thought, so i can set the server in that program? and restrict users/ips?

Brian
yes
awesome, thanks! How are you doing?

Brian
I am good, have a good weekend?
yes it was good. what are you doing for work?

Brian
software development for a company in phoenix
thats awesome! what kind of software, if you dont mind me asking
i found YnHub also. thanks

Brian
oh yeah.  And I work for a medical device company EPIC diagnostics in Scottsdale
thats awesome

Brian
writing a webform for collecting data from clinical trials

thats pretty nice
you like it?

Brian
Yeah, its fun.
What have you been up to?
meh, not too much. im working for the gov doing IT stuff. im actually looking for a job in phx doing any IT.
if i was going to start programming, what would you suggest starting with?

Brian
PHP, Python, or C#
pick anyone then download a large open source project off of source forge and learn how they use it, while reading a book on the language.
sweet. i was thinking about going back to school and possibly doing it. but im not sure.

Brian
Depends on what you want to do with it.  Languages aren't that hard to learn, learning to use them effectively is what is most difficult.
ah ok. yea, i am interested in app development. integrating 2 products.

Brian
like mobile?  what do you mean "app"?

mobile app.
im not sure. i would enjoy the problem solving but then hate it at the same time. networking is fun...but...

Brian
Ah.  Mobile apps are a bit of a different story.  Java and Python are your best bets.  But Android can run flash, javascript, and a variety of other languages.  Not sure what all the iPhone supports, but I know it's similar.  If you are doing that, you should find a platform development kit that can put your app on all mobile platforms.  Also, it would be unwise to seek out lots of profit, there isn't a whole lot of money in apps unless you have something completely original and incredibly useful.

i have ideas, just no resouces to get there, and by the time i do, it could be to late. 
idk, member when we had DC++?

Brian
haha yeah.  DC++ is still around.

i know, i figured out how to set up a server with some of my friends in phoenix, i hosted and people would connect in and we would share a little bit
where are you working at?

Brian
I am working for a medical device start-up in Scottsdale.  EPIC Research and Diagnostics.  http://www.epicdiagnostics.com/clearview
ClearView™ | Epic Research & Diagnostics
The ClearView™ Technology How it Works The EPIC ClearView measures electrical resistance of the skin by putting a fingertip in contact with a glass
epicdiagnostics.com
sweet!

Brian
Yeah, I get to do all the programming and IT stuff I want.
sweet, they need networking people?

Brian
Nope, just me.
haha, awesome!
